page.title: 20'The Last Supper' Reredos.
page.content: Behind the altar in Gloucester St. George, Tuffley is a sculpture in Welsh slate showing the cross and at the same time, a plan view of the table with our Lord and the disciples at the Last Supper. On first entering the church, one does not see the whole reredos, but only sufficient for the cross to appear symmetrical. Only when kneeling at the sanctuary step can one see all of it. This is to remind us that when we make the effort to come closer to God, we come to know Him better. The figures cannot be identified as any particular disciple _ except for Judas "slinking away" at the bottom right hand corner. The sculptor is Bryant Fedden of Winchcombe.
